entry.title: Theban tomb tracings made by Norman and Nina de Garis Davies
entry.content:
Theban tomb tracings made by Norman and Nina de Garis Davies
Concept and direction: Jaromir Malek
Catalogue: Helen Murray, Elizabeth Fleming and Alison Hobby
Editing: Hana Navrátilová, Elizabeth Fleming and Jaromir Malek
Scanning: Jenni Navratil, assisted by Hana Navrátilová
Photo-editing: Jenni Navratil
Coordination: Elizabeth Fleming
Detail of a scene in TT 65. Reconstruction by Hana Navrátilová Tombs

  • TT 1, Sennedjem, Servant in the Place of Truth. Dyn. XIX. (Deir el-Medina)
  • TT 8, Kha, Chief in the Great Place. Temp. Amenophis II to Amenophis III. (Deir el-Medina)
  • TT 10, Penbuy and Kasa, Servants in the Place of Truth. Temp. Ramesses II. (Deir el-Medina)
  • TT 11, Djehuti, Overseer of the treasury. Temp. Hatshepsut to Tuthmosis III. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 13, Shuroy, Head of brazier-bearers of Amun. Dyn. XIX-XX. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 16, Panehesi, Prophet of 'Amenophis of the Forecourt'. Temp. Ramesses II. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 17, Nebamun, Chief Physician. Temp. Amenophis II (?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 19, Amenmosi, First prophet of 'Amenophis of the Forecourt'. Temp. Ramesses I to Sethos I (?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 22, Wah, Royal butler. Partly usurped by Mery[amun], Eldest son of the King. Temp. Tuthmosis III(?). (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 23, Tjay To, Royal scribe of the dispatches of the Lord of the Two Lands. Temp. Merneptah. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 24, Nebamun, Steward of the royal wife Nebtu. Temp. Tuthmosis III. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 29, Amenemopet, Vizier. Temp. Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 38, Djeserkaresoneb, Counter of the grain in the granary of divine offerings of Amun. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 42, Amenmosi, Captain of troops. Temp. Tuthmosis III to Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 48, Amenemhet Surero, Chief steward. Temp. Amenophis IIII. (Khokha)
  • TT 53, Amenemhet, Agent of Amun. Temp. Tuthmosis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 56, Userhet, Royal scribe. Temp. Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 59, Ken, First prophet of Mut. Early Dyn. XVIII. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 62, Amenemwaskhet, Overseer of the Cabinet. Temp. Tuthmosis III (?). (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 63, Sebekhotep, Overseer of the seal. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 64, Hekerneheh, Nurse of the King's son Amenophis. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 65, Nebamun, Overseer of the Granary. Temp. Hatshepsut. Usurped by Imiseba, Head of the temple-scribes of the estate of Amun. Temp. Ramesses IX. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 67, Hepusoneb, First prophet of Amun. Temp. Hatshepsut. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 68, [Per?]enkhmun, wab-priest of Amun. Dyn. XX. Usurped by Espaneferhor, Head of the temple-scribes of the estate of Amun. Temp. Siamun. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 69, Menna, Scribe of the fields of the Lord of the Two Lands. Temp. Amenophis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 74, Tjanuny, Commander of soldiers. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 76, Tjenuna, Fan-bearer on the right of the King. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 77, Ptahemhet, Standard-bearer of the Lord of the Two Lands. Usurped by Roy, Overseer of the sculptors of the Lord of the Two Lands. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 78, Haremhab, Scribe of recruits. Temp. Tuthmosis III to Amenophis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 79, Menkheper Menkheperrasoneb, Overseer of the granary of the Lord of the Two Lands. Temp. Tuthmosis III to Amenophis II (?). (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 80, Djehutinufer, Overseer of the Treasury. Temp. Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 81, Ineni, Judge. Temp. Amenophis I to Tuthmosis III. (Sheikd Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 84, Amunedjeh, First royal herald. Temp. Tuthmosis III. Partly usurped by Mery. Temp. Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 85, Amenemhab Mahu, Lieutenant-commander of soldiers. Temp. Tuthmosis III to Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 95, Mery, First prophet of Amun. Temp. Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 96, Sennufer, Mayor of the Southern City. Temp. Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 101, Tjanuro, [Royal butler] clean of hands. Temp. Amenophis II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 108, Nebseny, First prophet of Onuris. Temp Tuthmosis IV (?). (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 120, Anen, Second prophet of Amun. Temp. Amenophis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 123, Amenemhet, Overseer of the granary. Temp. Tuthmosis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 125, Duauneheh, First herald. Temp. Hatshepsut. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 131, Amenuser or User, Vizier. Temp. Tuthmosis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 138, Nedjemger, Overseer of the garden in the Ramesseum in the estate of Amun. Temp. Ramesses II. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 139, Pairi, Overseer of peasants of Amun. Temp. Amenophis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 143, name lost. Temp. Tuthmosis III to Amenophis II (?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 151, Hety, Steward of the god's wife. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 153, name lost. Temp. Sethos I (?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 155, Antef, Great herald of the King. Temp. Hatshepsut and Tuthmosis III. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 161, Nakht, Bearer of the floral offerings of Amun. Temp. Amenophis III (?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 162, Kenamun, Mayor in the Southern City. Dyn. XVIII. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 176, [Amen]userhet, Servant clean of hands. Temp. Amenophis II to Tuthmosis IV. (Khokha)
  • TT 178, Neferronpet Kenro, Scribe of the treasury in the estate of Amen-re. Temp. Ramesses II. (Khokha)
  • TT 179, Nebamun, Counter of the grain in the granary of divine offerings of Amun. Temp. Hatshepsut. (Khokha)
  • TT 200, Dedi, Governor of the deserts on the west of Thebes. Temp. Tuthmosis III to Amenophis II. (Khokha)
  • TT 207, Haremhab, Scribe of divine offerings of Amun. Dyn. XIX-XX. (Khokha)
  • TT 215, Amenemopet, Royal Scribe in the Place of Truth. Dyn. XIX. (Deir el-Medina)
  • TT 217, Ipuy, Sculptor. Temp. Ramesses II. (Deir el-Medina)
  • TT 222, Hekmaetrenakht Turo, First prophet of Monthu Lord of Thebes. Temp. Ramesses III to IV. (Qurnet Murai)
  • TT 249, Neferronpet, Purveyor (?) of date-wine. Temp. Amenophis III. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 254, Amenmes called Mosi, Scribe of the treasury. Late Dyn. XVIII. (Khokha)
  • TT 259, Hori, Scribe in all the monuments of the estate of Amun. Dyn. XIX-XX. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)
  • TT 260, User, Overseer of the ploughed lands of [Amun]. Temp. Tuthmosis III. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 261, Khaemweset, wab-priest of Amenophis I. Dyn. XVIII. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 262, an Overseer of the fields. Temp. Tuthmosis III(?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 276, Amenemopet, Overseer of the treasury of gold and silver. Temp. Tuthmosis IV. (Qurnet Murai)
  • TT 277, Amenemonet, Divine father of the mansion of Amenophis III. Dyn. XIX-XX. (Qurnet Murai)
  • TT 278, Amenemhab, Herdsman of Amen-re. Dyn. XIX-XX. (Qurnet Murai)
  • TT 288, Bekenkhons, Scribe of the divine book of Khons. Dyn. XIX-XX. (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 296, Nefersekheru, Scribe of the divine offerings of all the gods. Dyn. XIX-XX. (Khokha)
  • TT 297, Amenemopet Tjonufer, Overseer of fields. Early Dyn. XVIII. (Asasif)
  • TT 333, name lost. Temp. Amenophis III(?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 334, a Chief of husbandmen. Temp. Amenophis III(?). (Dra Abu el-Naga)
  • TT 349, Tjay, Overseer of fowl-houses. Early Dyn. XVIII. (Sheikh Abd el-Qurna)

link.title: Theban tomb tracings made by Norman and Nina de Garis Davies
